page.title: 01A Fenland Linear Village
page.content: Deeping St Nicholas lies in the south of an extensive area of arable farming. Although this open, flat expanse of fenland is little above sea-level, these fertile silt-soils are kept well-drained by a well-defined system of long, straight-cut dykes and drains. Major crops are sugar-beet, cereals and potatoes, with some peas, field-beans and oil-see rape, grown for the most part on large business estates, employing the most modern and efficient mthods and machinery, and requiring little manual labour. Houses are spasmodically sited along the A16 trunk road, and the area fom the church of St Nicholas to the railway line is the most densely-populated section within the 6-miles long village. Most villagers commute to the larger neighbouring
